00047 #define _FC_MESH_P_H_

00053 // include these in basic data structures to simplify includes for the
00054 // the rest of the library which won't ever use them
00055 #include "tableP.h"
00056 #include "fileio.h"

00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
00061  *
00062  * \brief Mesh Slot Structure for the Mesh Table
00063  *
00064  * \description
00065  *
00066  *   This structure contains meta data and big data for a mesh.  First, it
00067  *   contains a header, a handle to the owning dataset, and a
00068  *   structure containing file IO info. In addition, it has information about
00069  *   the coordinates of it's vertices, it's topology (element to vertex
00070  *   relationships), and it knows what subsets and variables it owns (and what
00071  *   sequences it's associated with if any of the variables are sequence
00072  *   variables).
00073  *
00074  *   When a user asks for the coords as a variable, a reference to that
00075  *   variable is kept so that it can be re-fetched.  Also copy mesh, does not
00076  *   actually copy this variable but instead creates a coord variable on the
00077  *   new mesh.
00078  *
00079  *   A varSlot is associated with one step (e.g. time step) of a variable.
00080  *   However, access is through the more specific types of variables.  For
00081  *   instance, basic variables are those not associated with a sequence and
00082  *   have only varSlot each and can be accessed with 'numBasicVar' and
00083  *   'basicVarIDs'. The variable which provided the coordinates of the mesh is
00084  *   a basic variable but can also be accessed with member 'coordVarID' (there
00085  *   is only 1). (Not yet implemented: In addition, the non-coordinate basic
00086  *   vars can be accessed through 'numBasicNonCoordVar' and
00087  *   'basicNonCoordVarIDs'.)  Sequence variables are associated with a
00088  *   sequence. A sequence variable consists of an ordered group of
00089  *   varSlots. Some sequence information is repeated here from the seqSlots to
00090  *   ease access.
00091  *
00092  *   A mesh can only be made of one type of element.
00093  */
00094 typedef struct {
00095   _FC_SlotHeader header;  /**< Header, which contains general purpose info. */
00096   FC_Dataset ds;   /**< Handle to the owning dataset. */
00097   //---File reference 
00098   _FC_MeshFileIOInfo fileInfo; /**< Holds info pertinent to file access. */
00099   //---About the mesh:  vertices and elements
00100   int dim;         /**< The dimensionality of the vertex coordinates. */
00101   int topodim;     /**< The topological dimensionality of the mesh (e.g. 2D 
00102                 for a quad mesh, even if the vertices have 3D coords). */
00103   int numVertex;   /**< The number of vertices in the mesh. */
00104   int numElement;  /**< The number of elements in the mesh. */
00105   FC_ElementType elemType; /**< The type of element mesh is made of. */
00106   //---About the mesh: edges and faces, this is built info
00107   int numEdge;     /**< The number of edges in the mesh. Default value of -1
00108               means edge data has not been created. */
00109   int numFace;     /**< The number of faces in the mesh. Default value of -1
00110               means face data has not been created. */
00111   //---Provided data about mesh coordinates and connectivity
00112   double *coords;  /**< Big Data: the coordinates of the vertices stored as an
00113                       array of coordinates values with order xyzxyzxyz... 
00114                       (or xyxyxy if only 2D). This array will be numVertex*dim
00115                       long. */
00116   int *elemToVertConns;  /**< Big Data: the connectivity of the mesh. This is 
00117                 stored as an array of vertex indices for each element 
00118                 (e.g., for a mesh of two triangles and four vertices, the
00119                 array could be { 0 1 2 1 3 2 } where the first three 
00120                 numbers are the IDs of the vertices which are  make up 
00121                 the first triangle and then next three numbers are the 
00122                 vertices of the second triangle). Note that PATRAN 
00123                 ordering of vertices of an element is assumed. This array
00124                 will be numElement*(number of vertices per element) 
00125                 long. */
00126   //---Built data -- for edges & faces (downward conns)
00127   int* edgeToVertConns;  /**< Big Data: the vertices that make up the edges 
00128                    listed as E1V1 E1V2 ... EnV1 EnV2 */
00129   FC_ElementType* faceTypes; /**< Big Data: For each face, the face type */
00130   int* numVertPerFace;   /**< Big Data: For each face, the number of verts */
00131   int* faceToVertConns;  /**< Big Data: the vertices that make up the faces.
00132                    listed as all verts for first face, then all verts
00133                             for next face, etc. NOTE: For a list of mixed type
00134                    faces, for each face there is space for the maximum
00135                             possible number of verts; and if a face
00136                             has fewer verts, the extra spots hold -1 */
00137   int* elemToEdgeConns;  /**< Big Data: element to edge connectivity. For 
00138                    each element, the IDs of it's edges */
00139   int* elemToFaceConns;  /**< Big Data: element to face connectivity. For 
00140                    each element, the IDs of it's faces */
00141   int* elemFaceOrients;  /**< Big Data: the relative orientation of the face
00142                    in the element compared to the global face's */
00143   //---Built data -- parents (upward "conns") for all
00144   int* numEdgePerVert;   /**< Big Data: for each vert, # of parent edges */
00145   int** edgeParentsPerVert; /**< Big Data: for each vert, array of parent edge
00146                     IDs */
00147   int* numFacePerVert;   /**< Big Data: for each vert, # of parent faces. */
00148   int** faceParentsPerVert; /**< Big Data: for each vert, array of parent face
00149                     IDs */
00150   int* numElemPerVert;   /**< Big Data: for each vert, # of parent elems. */
00151   int** elemParentsPerVert; /**< Big Data: for each vert, array of parent
00152                     element IDs */
00153   int* numElemPerEdge;   /**< Big Data: for each edge, # of parent elems. */
00154   int** elemParentsPerEdge; /**< Big Data: for each edge, array of parent
00155                    element IDs */
00156   int* numElemPerFace;   /**< Big Data: for each face, # of parent elems. */
00157   int** elemParentsPerFace; /**< Big Data: for each face, array of parent
00158                     element IDs */
00159   //---Built data -- neighbors
00160   int* numVertNeighsViaEdge; /**< Big Data: for each vert, # of neighbor
00161                     verts connected by an edge */
00162   int** vertNeighsViaEdge;   /**< Big Data: for each vert, array of neighbor
00163                     verts connected by an edge */ 
00164   int* numElemNeighsViaVert; /**< Big Data: for each elem, # of neighbor
00165                     elems connected by an vert */
00166   int** elemNeighsViaVert;   /**< Big Data: for each elem, array of neighbor
00167                     elems connected by an vert */ 
00168   int* numElemNeighsViaEdge; /**< Big Data: for each elem, # of neighbor
00169                     elems connected by an edge */
00170   int** elemNeighsViaEdge;   /**< Big Data: for each elem, array of neighbor
00171                     elems connected by an edge */ 
00172   int* numElemNeighsViaFace; /**< Big Data: for each elem, # of neighbor
00173                     elems connected by an face */
00174   int** elemNeighsViaFace;   /**< Big Data: for each elem, array of neighbor
00175                     elems connected by an face */ 
00176   //---Owned entities
00177   //---subsets
00178   int numSub;         /**< Number of subsets owned by this mesh */
00179   int *subIDs;        /**< Array of slot numbers identifying subsets */
00180   int numSeqSub;         /**< Number of subsets owned by this mesh */
00181   int *numStepPerSeqSub; /**< Number of steps in each seq sub */
00182   int **seqSubIDs;        /**< Array of slot numbers identifying subsets */
00183   //---Variable breakdown: Access of variables by type = coord, basic, seq
00184   int coordVarID; /**< Slot ID of the coordinate array. This is -1 if
00185                        if there are no coords on the mesh, or the slotID 
00186                        of one of the basic variables. */
00187   int numBasicVar; /**< Number of basic variables (i.e. non-sequence vars) */
00188   int* basicVarIDs; /** < Array of slot IDs for the basic variables */
00189   int numSeqVar;    /**< Number of sequence variables owned by this mesh. */
00190   int *numStepPerSeqVar; /**< Number of steps in each seq var */
00191   int **seqVarIDs;   /**< Array of slot IDs identifying the vars that make 
00192                           up the sequence vars. This array has the dimensions
00193                           [numSeqVar][numStepPerSeq]. */
00194 } _FC_MeshSlot;
00195

00197 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshEdgeParentsOfVerticesPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00198                       int** numEdgePerVert, int*** edgeParentsPerVert);
00199 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshFaceParentsOfVerticesPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00200                       int** numFacePerVert, int*** edgeParentsPerVert);
00201 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfVerticesPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00202                       int** numElemPerVert, int*** elemParentsPerVert);
00203 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfEdgesPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00204                       int** numElemPerEdge, int*** elemParentsPerEdge);
00205 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfFacesPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00206                       int** numElemPerFace, int*** elemParentsPerFace);
00207 // Private big data access - neighbors

00209                 int** numVertNeighsViaEdge, int*** vertNeighsViaEdge);
00210 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementNeighborsViaVertexPtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00211                 int** numElemNeighsViaVert, int*** elemNeighsViaVert);
00212 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementNeighborsViaEdgePtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00213                 int** numElemNeighsViaEdge, int*** elemNeighsViaEdge);
00214 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementNeighborsViaFacePtr(FC_Mesh mesh, 
00215                 int** numElemNeighsViaFace, int*** elemNeighsViaFace);

00223 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(FC_Mesh mesh,
